abstract: Motorola, the subject of rampant deal rumors on Wall Street this week, on Wednesday sliced about $1 billion off of its revenue projections for the quarter and announced a management shake-up. The beleaguered cellphone giant also said it was expanding a stock-buyback program, addressing a demand of the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, who has become a major Motorola shareholder.
lead_paragraph: Motorola, the subject of rampant deal rumors on Wall Street this week, on Wednesday sliced about $1 billion off of its revenue projections for the quarter and announced a management shake-up. The beleaguered cellphone giant also said it was expanding a stock-buyback program, addressing a demand of the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, who has become a major Motorola shareholder.
